course.subject: MARK
course.name: Brand Management
course.description: This course is designed to help students develop a practical understanding of the tools, rules, and strategies of brand management.  By the end of the semester, students will be able to assess critical aspects of a branding strategy such as: how to introduce and name new products; how to interpret brand performance; and how to manage a brand over time, product categories, and geographical markets.  MARK 4450 is intended for individuals considering careers at senior levels of corporate management or as consultants in strategy firms, ad agencies, and market research companies.

reviews.author: qso
reviews.comment_content: Compared to the French Prof. who usually teach this course, the content taught by this Prof. is much easier. It is easy but a bit disorganized. Topics don't seem to be relevant to each other.
reviews.comment_teaching: She showed a lot of videos in class and teaching is clear. The content is not difficult to understand so her teaching is also good.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Easy content but exam requires memorizing content. If you remember all the content on notes, high marks in exam is guaranteed.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too heavy, only one final group project and two quiz. There's sample project and the page limit makes the project's workload light.

reviews.author: olle
reviews.title: One of my best courses. Absolutely recommended
reviews.comment_content: I found the content really unique and distinctive from usual marketing courses that teach mainly about promotion and advertising. This course covers mostly about what brands should do in order to lead customers to become loyal and what brands should focus on for long term successes. Brand equity, brand perception, factor analysis, and positioning are mostly topics of this course. Really practical and helpful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Absolutely one of my best professors I have ever had in college. She has been teaching for over 20 years and always explains complicated concepts really clearly (she even makes them sound super easy sometimes). Her examples in class and choice of cases are really practical and helpful for understanding the concepts.
She is one of the professors that are always there whenever you have concerns/questions. You can visit her during her office hours for extra questions and she will always be willing to help you.  
Anyone interested in branding/brand management/brand agency, you should totally take this course!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 30%
Quiz 2: 30%
Best quiz performance will be weighted more so that the better quiz is worth 60% and the other is worth 40% (a 3:2 ratio)
Brand Audit Presentation and analysis :30%
participation and attendance: 5%
Blog about class learning: 3%
Research credit: 2%

Got 88 out of 100 on first quiz (1 SD above mean)
Got 53 out of 60 on second quiz (about 0.5 SD above mean)
Full mark on participation
not sure about report  & presentation but the professor appreciated all groups' efforts so I think she gave out good grades.
Turned in all 4 blogs on time.  

Got an A
reviews.comment_workload:
I loved how she set different dates for group report draft due dates because it helped us to plan ahead instead of waiting until the final report due date. She gives out feedback to each part of the report and the guidelines for the project are straightforward so it saved us a lot of time.
If you attend the lectures, you do not necessarily have to put extra effort into studying for exams because the professor prepares you well for the tests.
Just attend the lectures and follow the professor's guidelines for the projects and you should be fine.

reviews.author: svc
reviews.comment_content: Pretty interesting content and relevant to the course. Interesting cases chosen. You might find the blog component annoying or you might enjoy it to reflect - doesn't get too serious until the last blog!
reviews.comment_teaching: Very dedicated teacher and extremely helpful. You could approach her quite easily for project advise or other subject related discussions out of class as well. Only very few instances of falling behind schedule.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading seems very normal and fair to me. Although attendance is supposedly counted, I think if you contribute to the in-class discussion or occasional questions, that should over-ride your average attendance (if you're the 75-80% attendance kind of student).
reviews.comment_workload: Occasional worksheets to fill in as per the cases to read as homework.

reviews.author: Chriskoala
reviews.comment_content: The contents are easy to understand, useful knowledge and interesting. Course materials include ppts, case booklet, and worksheets. Case analysis is very important and the worksheets are mostly based on the cases.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good professor, the way she taught was very clear, easy to understand, many real life examples.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grading
Quiz 1*30%
Quiz 2*30%
*Best quiz performance will be weighted more so that the better quiz is worth 60% and the other is worth 40% (a 3:2 ratio)

Brand Audit Presentation and analysis 30%

Class performance (In class mini assignments, Case participation and attendance) 5%
*attendance is important, the professor recognized all the students in class

Self Assessment of Learning 3%

Research credit 2%

*Absolute grading

Final grade I got: A (90/100 for Quiz 1, 55.5/60 for Quiz 2, don't know about the project grade but I think every group should got similar grade)
reviews.comment_workload: Quite Heavy, need to write four blogs in total (Self Assessment of Learning), the brand audit project required to submit 3 drafts on different parts before final submission (the drafts are not graded), the in class assignments are quite easy, there were 5 cases in total (extremely important, suggested to read all of them carefully, pay attention to the case analysis in class, all the stuff of the case analysis mentioned in class will show up in the quizzes)

reviews.author: tmcab
reviews.title: Great marketing course
reviews.comment_content: What builds brand equity and what erodes brand equity, quantitative and qualitative analysis methods, case studies. A very practical approach instead of just textbook content
reviews.comment_teaching: Awesome professor, I like how clear she explains the concepts and the lectures are usually interactive. Loves using cases for teaching, which are useful for understanding concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1*
30%
Quiz 2*
30%
Brand Audit Presentation and analysis
30%
Class performance: In class mini assignments (Credit/No credit), Case participation and attendance
5%
Self Assessment of Learning 3%
Research credit 2%
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy because of the brand audit group project, but the professor already drafted a timeline for the project so as long as you follow the plan it's totally ok.

reviews.author: carmenlwm
reviews.title: econ 2113
reviews.comment_content: some of the topics are taught in secondary school so it is easy for student to catch up with even though they have missed the lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her lesson is not boring because she will prepare some games during the lesson and invites student to participate.What's more video will be played so as to explain economic theories
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not good because the mean is very high.There are two mid terms and both means are higher than 85/100.Even though i got 87% as the total score i get a B only.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not as heavy as other lecturers.What we have to do are 10 online quizzes and two problem sets
